title: Why Boris Johnson's deal could completely wipe out the British fishing industry
text:
For a horrific price, the UK is being pushed towards an FTA on EU terms

While the PM must be congratulated for his commendable efforts, playing a bad hand well to negotiate an improvement on Theresa May's deal, it is, regrettably still far from good enough. Jubilation that something has changed is not justification to accept something that still has the flaws that those now cheering the PM had lambasted six months ago.

The backstop has not been removed, but diluted. Northern Ireland may officially remain part of the UK customs union, but, in practice, it will be under the auspices of the EU customs union. This sets a precedent for undermining the Union.

The European Court of Justice (ECJ) will...
description: For a horrific price, the UK is being pushed towards an FTA on EU terms
